metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28010 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Exim 4 before 4.94.2 allows Out-of-bounds Write because the main function, while setuid root, copies the current working directory pathname into a buffer that is too small (on some common platforms).

notes.Note: leosilva> code introduced later, xenial and trusty ESM not affected

criterions.comment: exim4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
